alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Cheshire County through 815 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westminster, or near Bellows Falls, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keene, Swanzey, Winchester, Richmond, Walpole, Hinsdale, Westmoreland, Chesterfield, Surry and Alstead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
